Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves

Class BezierCurve

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves.BezierCurve
All Implemented Interfaces:
Curve
public class BezierCurve extends Object implements Curve
This is the BezierCurve class. This class handles the creation of Bezier curves, which are used as the basis of the path for the Path class. Bezier curves are parametric curves defined by a set of control points. So, they take in one input, t, that ranges from [0, 1] and that returns a point on the curve. Essentially, Bezier curves are a way of defining a parametric line easily. You can read more on Bezier curves here: ...

  • Constructor Details

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve()
      This is the default constructor for the BezierCurve class. It initializes an empty BezierCurve. This is not recommended to use, as it does not set any control points or path constraints.

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve(List<Pose> controlPoints, PathConstraints constraints)
      This constructor creates a BezierCurve with the specified control points and path constraints.
      Parameters:
      controlPoints - the control points for the BezierCurve, which must be at least 3 points.
      constraints - the path constraints for the BezierCurve.

    • BezierCurve

      protected BezierCurve(PathConstraints constraints, List<FuturePose> controlPoints)
      This constructor creates a BezierCurve with the specified control points and path constraints.
      Parameters:
      constraints - the path constraints for the BezierCurve.
      controlPoints - the control points for the BezierCurve, which must be at least 3 points.

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve(List<Pose> controlPoints)
      This constructor creates a BezierCurve with the specified control points and the default path constraints.
      Parameters:
      controlPoints - the control points for the BezierCurve, which must be at least 3 points.

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve(PathConstraints constraints, FuturePose... controlPoints)
      This constructor creates a BezierCurve with the specified control points and path constraints.
      Parameters:
      constraints - the path constraints for the BezierCurve.
      controlPoints - the control points for the BezierCurve, which must be at least 3 points.

      Specified by:
      getPanelsDrawingPoints in interface Curve
      Returns:
      returns the 2D Array to draw on Panels

    • generateBezierCurve

      public void generateBezierCurve()
      This generates the Bezier curve. It assumes that the ArrayList of control points has been set. This caches the matrix generated by multiplying the characteristic matrix and the matrix where each control point is a row vector.

    • getEndTangent

      public Vector getEndTangent()
      This returns the unit tangent Vector at the end of the BezierCurve.
      Specified by:
      getEndTangent in interface Curve
      Returns:
      returns the end tangent Vector.

    • approximateLength

      public double approximateLength()
      This approximates the length of the BezierCurve in APPROXIMATION_STEPS number of steps. It's like a Riemann's sum, but for a parametric function's arc length.
      Returns:
      returns the approximated length of the BezierCurve.

    • initializeDegreeArray

      public void initializeDegreeArray()
      Initializes the degree/power array (for later processing) and cache them

    • initializeCoefficientArray

      public void initializeCoefficientArray()
      Initializes the coefficient array (for later processing) and cache them. Each row is a different level of differentiation.

    • getTVector

      public double[] getTVector(double t, int diffLevel)
      This method gets the t-vector at the specified differentiation level.
      Parameters:
      t - t value of the parametric curve; [0, 1]
      diffLevel - specifies how many differentiations are done
      Returns:
      t vector

    • getPose

      public Pose getPose(double t)
      This returns the point on the Bezier curve that is specified by the parametric t value. A Bezier curve is a parametric function that returns points along it with t ranging from [0, 1], with 0 being the beginning of the curve and 1 being at the end. The Follower will follow BezierCurves from 0 to 1, in terms of t.
      Specified by:
      getPose in interface Curve
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the point requested.

    • getCurvature

      public double getCurvature(double t)
      This returns the curvature of the Bezier curve at a specified t-value.
      Specified by:
      getCurvature in interface Curve
      Parameters:
      t - the parametric t input.
      Returns:
      returns the curvature.

    • getDerivative

      public Vector getDerivative(double t)
      This returns the derivative on the BezierCurve that is specified by the parametric t value. This is returned as a Vector, and this Vector is the tangent to the BezierCurve.
      Specified by:
      getDerivative in interface Curve
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the derivative requested.

    • getSecondDerivative

      public Vector getSecondDerivative(double t)
      This returns the second derivative on the BezierCurve that is specified by the parametric t value. This is returned as a Vector, and this Vector is the acceleration on the BezierCurve.
      Specified by:
      getSecondDerivative in interface Curve
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the second derivative requested.

    • getPointCharacteristics

      public Matrix getPointCharacteristics(double t)
      This method calculates the position, velocity, and acceleration and puts them into a matrix as row vectors.
      Parameters:
      t - t value of the parametric curve; [0, 1]
      Returns:
      matrix with row vectors corresponding to position, velocity, and acceleration at the requested t value

    • getNormalVector

      public Vector getNormalVector(double t)
      This gets an approximate second derivative essentially using the limit method. This is used for heading only
      Specified by:
      getNormalVector in interface Curve
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the approximated second derivative.

      public static BezierCurve through(Pose startPoint, Pose midpoint, Pose endPoint)
      Generates a BezierCurve that passes through the given points
      Parameters:
      startPoint - the initial point the curve passes through
      midpoint - a point in the middle for the curve to pass through
      endPoint - the final point the curve passes through
      Returns:
      the BezierCurve passing through the points

      midPoint1 - the second point the curve passes through
